tit.e: Kokuho Chaseki San-Meiseki, Japan's three most celebrated tea ceremony houses and a designated national treasure

Kokuho Chaseki San-Meiseki (Three National Treasure Teahouses)
tit.cmt: タイトルのため、簡潔になるよう修正しました。

sen.j: 国宝茶席三名席（こくほうちゃせきさんめいせき）
京都山崎大徳寺妙喜庵内の待庵
sen.e: Tai-an Teahouse at Daitoku-ji Myoki-an Temple in Oyamazaki Town, Kyoto Prefecture
Tai-an Teahouse at Daitoku-ji Myoki-an Temple in Oyamazaki Town, Kyoto Prefecture
Tai-an Teahouse at the Myoki-an of Daitoku-ji Temple in Yamazaki, Kyoto
sen.cmt: the Myoki-an of Daitoku-ji Templeとしました。（ただし、妙喜庵は大徳寺の塔頭寺院ではなく、原文の内容は誤りと思われます。）原文の「京都山崎」に合わせ、Oyamazaki Town, Kyoto Prefecture→Yamazaki, Kyotoとしました。

sen.j: 大徳寺龍光院 (京都市)内の密庵
sen.e: the Mitsuan-teahouse at the Ryuko-in of Daitoku-ji Temple (Kyoto City)
The Mitsuan-teahouse at the Ryuko-in of Daitoku-ji Temple (Kyoto City)
Mitsu-an Teahouse at the Ryoko-in of Daitoku-ji Temple (Kyoto City)
sen.cmt: 他の表記と合わせ、Mitsu-an Teahouseとし、龍光院の読みを"Ryoko-in"に修正(参照:http://www.tondaya.co.jp/map/daitoku/daitoku.html)

sen.j: 京都建仁寺正伝院内に過去あり、現在、犬山城下有楽苑にある如庵
sen.e: Joan Teahouse that was formerly located at Kyoto's Kennin-ji Shoden-in Temple, but is now situated in the Uraku-en Garden of Inuyama Castle
Joan Teahouse was formerly located at Kyoto's Kennin-ji Shoden-in Temple, but is now situated in the Uraku-en Garden of Inuyama Castle
Jo-an Teahouse that was formerly located at Kyoto's Shoden-in of Kennin-ji Temple, but is now situated in the Uraku-en Garden of Inuyama-jo Castle
sen.cmt: Jo-an Teahouse、Shoden-in of Kennin-ji Temple、Inuyama-jo Castleとし、原文どおり「～にある如庵」となるよう、Jo-an Teahouseのあとに関係代名詞thatを入れました。

sen.j: いずれも、現存する茶道文化史上最高部類の貴重な遺構とされる。
sen.e: These are all considered to be the most valuable surviving teahouses in the history of Japan's tea ceremony culture.
